result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew A Olmstead was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence credit for 262 days were granted.
Early release after 2 years if Agent approves.

miscConds.notes: Costs/DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of illegal controlled substance or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Disclose to any physician in writing your conditions of probation, provide a copy to your Agent.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

No contact with Jaylene Hamilton.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber with non-working hours with standard release conditions-STAYED.

ADDRESS INFO for Andrew A Olmstead
Current: N70 W23957 Prides Road, Sussex, WI 53089 United States  (Effective: 11-30-2016)
Prior: 515 W. Moreland Blvd., c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States

Defendant Andrew A Olmstead in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was discharged from drug treatment court.  Court enters the judgment of guilty on count #1.  Count #2 was previously dismissed and read in.  16CF348 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Bricco makes statements.  Defendant's father makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

5 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 262 days )
3 Years of Initial Confinement
2 Years of Extended Supervision

Term of Probation: 3 Years, early release after 2 years if agent 

Conditions of Probation:

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
	
No contact with Jaylene Hamilton.
	
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;

Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;

No Use or Possession of  illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;

Inform agent of all prescriptions;

Disclose to any physician in writing your conditions of probation provide a copy to your Agent. 

Seek part time employment;

Condition Time: 45 days Huber with  NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS -  STAYED 

COSTS:  $268.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Surcharge: $250.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program

Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  

Expunction is denied.
